results.title: Senescence-associated secretory phenotype contributes to pathological angiogenesis in retinopathy.
results.text_hl: Therapeutic inhibition of the SASP through intravitreal delivery of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ or interference with effectors of senescence (@GENE_SEMA3A @GENE_20346 @@@semaphorin 3A@@@ or @GENE_ERN1 @GENE_78943 @@@IRE1alpha@@@) in @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ reduced destructive @<m>DISEASE_Retinal_Neovascularization</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015861 @@@retinal neovascularization@@@ in vivo.

citations.NLM: Oubaha M, Miloudi K, Dejda A, Guber V, Mawambo G, Germain MA, Bourdel G, Popovic N, Rezende FA, Kaufman RJ, Mallette FA, Sapieha P. Senescence-associated secretory phenotype contributes to pathological angiogenesis in retinopathy. Sci Transl Med. 2016 Oct 26;8(362):362ra144. PMID: 27797960
